cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 70 mi SSE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest, then north-northwest across the Lower Florida Keys and up the west coast of Florida toward the Florida panhandle and southwestern Georgia

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Fernandina Beach, FL to Edisto Beach, SC (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Fernandina Beach southward around the Florida peninsula to Indian Pass, including the Florida Keys, Lake Okeechobee and Florida Bay; Storm Surge Warning from South Santee River, SC southward to Jupiter Inlet, FL and around the peninsula to the Ochlockonee River, including Tampa Bay and the Florida Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula (east and west coasts), Florida Keys, and adjacent southeast U.S. coastline
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (87%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds with a 19% chance of 50-kt winds. Hurricane-force gusts are possible Sunday as Irma passes southwest of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground level possible along the Broward County coast, including Port Everglades, especially around the time of high tide Sunday into early Monday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches of rain with locally higher amounts up to 20 inches possible, capable of producing flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents likely; long-period operational disruption due to port closure under Hurricane Warning.
